SEARCH
Package com.simcraft.interfaces

Interface VisualEffect

All Known Implementing Classes:
HitFlashEffect, HorizontalScreenWipeEffect, TimedVisualEffect
public interface VisualEffect
The VisualEffect interface defines the contract for visual effects that can be applied within the game. Implementations of this interface will be responsible for updating their state over time, rendering themselves onto a Graphics2D context, and managing their active and finished states. This interface provides a common structure for various visual enhancements such as animations, transitions, and status indicators.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    draw(Graphics2D g2d)
    Draws the visual effect onto the provided Graphics2D context.
    boolean
    isEffectActive()
    Checks if the visual effect is currently active and running.
    boolean
    isEffectFinished()
    Checks if the visual effect has completed its intended duration, animation, or process.
    void
    startEffect()
    Starts the visual effect.
    void
    updateEffect()
    Updates the state of the visual effect.

  • Method Details

    • updateEffect

      void updateEffect()
      Updates the state of the visual effect. This method is typically called in each frame of the game loop to advance the effect's animation, modify its properties (e.g., position, color, alpha), or check for completion.

    • draw

      void draw(Graphics2D g2d)
      Draws the visual effect onto the provided Graphics2D context. The implementation of this method will define how the effect is rendered on the screen, taking into account its current state.
      Parameters:
      g2d - The graphics context to draw on. Implementations should use this context to perform drawing operations.

    • startEffect

      void startEffect()
      Starts the visual effect. This method is called to initialize the effect's state, set any starting parameters, and begin its visual process or animation. An effect might need to be started before its updateEffect() and draw(Graphics2D) methods are called.

    • isEffectFinished

      boolean isEffectFinished()
      Checks if the visual effect has completed its intended duration, animation, or process. This method is used to determine when the effect should be considered finished and potentially removed or stopped.
      Returns:
      true if the effect has finished, false otherwise.

    • isEffectActive

      boolean isEffectActive()
      Checks if the visual effect is currently active and running. An effect might be started but not yet finished, in which case it would be active. This can be used to determine if the effect should be updated and drawn.
      Returns:
      true if the effect is active, false otherwise.
